Installation

Our team developed the BetterDeal application with the Django web-development framework which is based on the Python programming language, so to be able to use it, first the so-called Python interpreter and also Django should be installed.

Python

First we should download and install the Python interpreter. From here it can be downloaded: https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-395

At the bottom of that page we should choose the suitable one for our computer, and click on that one.

After that, in "downloads" we can find an .exe file. Clicking on that file will start the installation.

We should accept "Add Python 3.9 to PATH" and after that we click on "Install now", and the followings will execute the installation.


Django

To install Django we have to use the so-called Command Line, a terminal window. To open this we have to type to the search box in the start menu "cmd", and it will appear right away. Just to try it out we can check that we actually installed the python interpreter. We have to type "python --version", then press Enter:

It does not show any error message, so it means we have python, and we even found out the version. Now we can install Django.

To install Django we have to type the following command "pip install Django==3.2.9", then press Enter. The installation will be executed, the following pictures show it.


Now everything is prepared for starting the application.

Start the App

To start BetterDeal, we have to download the whole project. Once we got it, we have to open again the command line. After that we have to navigate ourselves to that directory of the project which contains a file called "manage.py". For navigation we use the "cd" command. With cd we can go into one directory, with command "cd..", we can step out (or step back) of a directory. The followings show these steps:



Once we arrived to the right directory, with the following command we have to start a server on which our web application will run: "python manage.py runserver" It is really important to start the server, without it, the application won't work.

Now just one step remained, we have to open the website in our browser. For that, we have to copy this link into the browser's addres bar: http://localhost:8000/app/ And finally we can start to use the application!
